noun.description: A loop of rope arranged like a sling, used for raising or lowering casks and other cylindrical objects along an inclined plane.

verb.description: Raise or lower with a parbuckle.
examples: the gun has to be parbuckled across a ditch

origin: Early 17th century: from earlier parbunkle, of unknown origin. The change in the ending was due to association with buckle.
